lead_paragraph: The article, by a straight writer who used dating apps to find athletes, drew criticism that it endangered the lives of some Olympians from countries where homosexuality is illegal.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER MELE and NIRAJ CHOKSHI

headline.print_headline: Website Removes Article on Gay Olympians in Rio
headline.main: Daily Beast Removes Article on Gay Olympians in Rio

snippet: The article, by a straight writer who used dating apps to find athletes, drew criticism that it endangered the lives of some Olympians from countries where homosexuality is illegal....
abstract: Article on The Daily Beast website about Olympic athletes using dating apps is pulled following widespread criticism over details it gave about gay athletes; story was initially revised to excise details that made it easy to identify athletes in question, some of whom come from countries where homosexuality is frowned upon.
